instruction: Please describe the findings regarding market liquidity during the COVID-19 outbreak of March 2020.
output: Our research indicates that the introduction of a new, volume-based approach would have demonstrated improving liquidity during the COVID-19 outbreak in March 2020, as traded volumes increased significantly during that period. In contrast, the current, price-impact approach would have captured the deteriorating market liquidity. This highlights the potential limitations of using a classification methodology solely based on traded volumes, particularly in highly volatile markets.
